page.title: 05Farm Buildings and Machinery
page.content: Mr. Schofield has two sheep sheds, one is a sheep handling shed and the other shed is where they keep the sheep in the winter and for lambing. There are two cow sheds. One is where the heifers go in for the winter, the other is for the cows to go in during the winter. There is also a hay shed where they keep the odd bales of hay. Both sheep sheds are modern but the heifers shed is old. Mr. Schofield has two tractors for pulling anything. He has two trailers for putting hay or straw and things that you can't carry on. He has a hay bob for turning the hay, one silage cutter for cutting the grass, two rollers for rolling the ground and a baler for baling the hay. He has a farm bike for going to look at his stock and a Toyota pick up truck.
